description: The underlying cause of CVE-2024-20697 is a flaw in the Windows Libarchive component that allows for remote code execution. This vulnerability arises due to improper handling of user input when processing specially crafted archive files. The flaw permits an unauthorized individual with local access to the system to execute arbitrary code. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability necessitates specific conditions, including low privileges and user interaction, such as tricking the victim into opening a malicious archive. The affected products include various builds of Windows 11, specifically versions 22H2 and 23H2, as well as Windows Server 2022, serving as a critical entry point for potential exploitation.
